conclusion: To determine the power of the electromagnetic railgun, calculate the total power input to the system.
Power input is the product of the current flowing through the system and the resistance of the system.
The current is the rail current, and the resistance is the resistance of the projectile.
Total current flowing through the system is the sum of the current flowing from the first rail and the current flowing back through the second rail.
Current flowing from the first rail is calculated as I * (L/d).
Current flowing back through the second rail is calculated as I * (L/d).
Total current is calculated as 2 * I * (L/d).
Total current is calculated as 5000 A.
Resistance of the projectile is negligible since it is a uniform magnetic field.
Power input is calculated as Total current * Resistance.
Power input is calculated as 5000 A * 0 A.
Power input is calculated as 0 W.
The power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched is 0 watts.
